title: Eight hurt as stolen truck crashes into cars in Germany
text:
Eight hurt as stolen truck crashes into cars in Germany

German authorities are investigating a man who rammed a stolen truck into a line of cars in the town of Limburg in the western state of Hesse, injuring eight people.

The 32-year-old had pulled the driver of the truck from his cabin at a red light before using the vehicle to plough into eight cars waiting at a light near Limburg’s central station at around 5:20pm on Monday.

The man, a Syrian national named as Omar AI by the national broadcaster ARD, was arrested on the scene.

A number of German media reports, citing security sources, reported that authorities believed the incident to have a terrorist background. However, a spokesperson for the general public prosecutor in Frankfurt said they could not confirm a terrorist motive and were still investigating the case.

According to news agency DPA, the suspect has lived in Germany since 2015 and was known to the police for a number of minor criminal offences including possession of drugs and theft.

However, he had no known links to Islamist extremist circles.

Marius Hahn, the mayor of Limburg, said he was shocked by the incident. He said: “My thoughts are with the injured victims of the accident and their families.”
description: Authorities investigating 32-year-old Syrian national over incident in Limburg
